nl_problem:
# Task: Nested Logic Test (Depth 1)
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: checkNested(self, x0: int) -> bool

# Objective:
This is a test of structural nesting. Return True ONLY if all the following conditions are met:
1. x0 is greater than 0

Each condition must be checked inside the previous one (nested if statements).
lisp_spec:
Here is the LISP specification for the given natural language problem:

(task
  (name "checkNested")
  (signature ( (x0 int) ) bool)
  (constraints
    (constraint "x0 must be greater than 0.")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Return True if all conditions are met, nested if statements.")
    (rule "Nested if statements: each condition must be checked inside the previous one.")
    (return "True if all conditions are met, False otherwise.")
  )
)

Note that I've followed the strict rules provided, including matching the `Method` name exactly in the `(name ...)` and `(signature ...)` sections.
